abstract_summ: Interactive curves generated from the W-LSTM model can be seen at http://collaboration.coraltele.com/covid2/.Abstract In this paper, a generalized fractional-order SEIR model is proposed, denoted by SEIQRP model, which has a basic guiding significance for the prediction of the possible outbreak of infectious diseases like COVID-19 and other insect diseases in the future.The model can function on cloud, take inputs in real time and handle large data country wise, at low costs to make predictions dynamically.The model identified age groups, trade with China, air traffic, country temperature and CoV-2 virus types as the likely effectors of infection and virulence leading to deaths.The W-LSTM model developed in this study, performs better in terms of MSE, R2 and MAPE, as compared to the previously published models, including ARIMA, LSTM and their variations.According to the real data of the United States, it is found that our improved model has a better prediction ability for the epidemic trend in the next two weeks.
title_summ: Analysis and Prediction of COVID-19 Characteristics Using a Birth-and-Death ModelA Cybernetics-based Dynamic Infection Model for Analyzing SARS-COV-2 Infection Stability and Predicting Uncontrollable RisksModelling for prediction of the spread and severity of COVID-19 and its association with socioeconomic factors and virus typesForecast analysis of the epidemics trend of COVID-19 in the United States by a generalized fractional-order SEIR model
title_abstract_phrases: Interactive curves generated from the W-LSTM model can be seen at http://collaboration.coraltele.com/covid2/.Forecast analysis of the epidemics trend of COVID-19 in the United States by a generalized fractional-order SEIR modelAbstract In this paper, a generalized fractional-order SEIR model is proposed, denoted by SEIQRP model, which has a basic guiding significance for the prediction of the possible outbreak of infectious diseases like COVID-19 and other insect diseases in the future.The model can function on cloud, take inputs in real time and handle large data country wise, at low costs to make predictions dynamically.Modelling for prediction of the spread and severity of COVID-19 and its association with socioeconomic factors and virus typesWe report the development of a Weibull based Long-Short-Term-Memory approach (W-LSTM) for the prediction of COVID-19 disease.In this study we propose a birth-and-death model for predicting the number of COVID-19 active cases.The model identified age groups, trade with China, air traffic, country temperature and CoV-2 virus types as the likely effectors of infection and virulence leading to deaths.
